channel.title: Mosaic: World News From The Middle East
channel.description: Selection of daily news reports in English from a variety of Middle Eastern broadcasters from Morocco and Egypt, Israel and The Palestinian Authority, to Iraq and Iran.

item.title: Mosaic Summary, December 30, 2003 - Algeria Freezes Majority Party's Assets
item.description: Segments include: Algeria Freezes Majority Party's Assets; U.S. Intelligence Teams Gather Info on Iraqi Attacks; More Deaths in Baghdad; James Baker Heads Back to Washington, Iraqi Debts Reduced; Israeli Occupation Forces Raid Palestinian Areas; Palestinians See Israeli Dismantling as PR Campaign; Israeli Raids Wounds Palestinians, Homes Demolished; Palestinians See Israeli Move as PR Stunt; Sharon Warns that Illegal Settler Outposts May Be Removed; Israeli Officials Support Sharon Position... Places referenced include: Baghdad; Beijing; Gaza; Nablus; Sharon; U.S.; West Bank... TV stations contributing segments include: Abu Dhabi TV, UAE; Al Manar TV, Lebanon; Jordan TV, Jordan; IBA TV, Israel; Prime Minster Ariel Sharon is expected to give a speech about evacuating settlements if negotiations with Palestinians fail. There is a possibility that illegal settlement posts, that were built in the last few months, will be evacuated, especially the Migrun Settlement near Ramallah. Settlers are preparing themselves to counter that possibility. One Israeli settler explained, "No one can deny that there is an atmosphere of anxiety here. One must be careful because of the situation we live in. We may be forced to evacuate the settlement. You are visiting me in a settlement that has received orders to evacuate, including the 43 families that live here. It appears that we should not expect positive surprises." Migrun settlement post is witnessing a lot of support; dozens of Israelis have come in solidarity with the families who live here. The Rabbinic Settlement Counsel called on settlers to be cautious and avoid violent confrontations with the defense army. They also called on the Prime Minister to reverse his decision to evacuate the settlement and avoid creating confrontations between soldiers and settlers. ; ANN TV, England

Places referenced include: Amman; Baghdad; Beijing; Bethlehem; Damascus; Iraq; Israel; Morocco; Nablus; Southern Sahara; village of Alghajar... TV stations contributing segments include: Abu Dhabi TV, UAE; Al Manar TV, Lebanon; Jordan TV, Jordan; IBA TV, Israel; In the American capital of Washington, a senior U.S. official described the speech of Prime Minister Ariel Sharon, as a very positive development that may facilitate the peace negotiations on the basis of the Road Map plan. He denied reports claming that the U.S. administration is not satisfied with Sharon's speech saying that they are based on misinterpretations to what the White House spokesman said. The senior U.S. official also added that the White House is not opposed to unilateral steps if they help achieve the Road Map for peace between Israel and the Palestinians. Scott McClellan, the White House spokesman said that he was satisfied with the Israeli Prime Minister's commitment to the Road Map plan. ; Shimon Peres, the leader of the Israeli Labor party said that Prime Minister Ariel Sharon must be committed to the Road Map and the Palestinian leadership must stop terrorism or else it will be labeled as an authority that supports terrorism. He met with foreign Ambassadors in Israel in the wake of the Ariel Sharon's speech in Hertzelia.; Nile TV, Egypt; 2M TV, Morocco

TV stations contributing segments include: Abu Dhabi TV, UAE; Dubai TV, UAE; IBA TV, Israel; The Israeli President, Moshe Katsav hosted delegates from the European Jewish Congress, including leaders of 26 Jewish communities through out Europe. They came to the country to express their solidarity with the Israeli people. President Katsav gave a speech, saying that there are internal conflicts within the Palestinian leadership, between constructive elements that want peace and destructive elements like Hamas and the Islamic Jihad movements. President Katasve demanded the European countries to give the Palestinian Authority an ultimatum to stop terrorism in order to pave the road for resuming the peace negotiations between the two sides. ; The Palestinian Ministerial and National committees held a joint a special meeting with the participation of Yasser Arafat, the President of the Authority. During the meeting, the performance of the Palestinian security agencies was discussed in order to find a solution for the lack of security and respect to law and Palestinian Authority in Palestinian areas. At the end of the urgent meeting, announcement was made about a series of reforms in Palestinian security agencies with the objective of improving the security situation. The most important reform that was introduced is a plan to manage the operations of all Palestinian security agencies through two centers one in the West Bank and another in Gaza. Police forces with official uniforms will be deployed in the streets to enforce the law, maintain order ad security, and end all forms of ciaos including the mess in weapons use. The police will prevent any violation that may jeopardize commitments made by the PLO and National Authority. ; Al Manar TV, Lebanon; Jordan TV, Jordan

TV stations contributing segments include: Abu Dhabi TV, UAE; Al Manar TV, Lebanon; IBA TV, Israel; In Rabin's square in Tel Aviv city, about 120 thousand people who support right wing parties demonstrated against Arial Sharon's policies after announcing that he intends to evacuate settlements and separate from the Palestinians. Demonstrators called on the Prime Minister not to compromise and take unilateral steps. Four Ministers and 19 Knesset members from the coalition government participated in the demonstration. The Yehoda and Samera, and Gaza councils organized the demonstration for first time in three and half years in Rabin's square, which was considered the largets demonstration against the Prime Minister's policy toward the Palestinians. The President of the National Union Party, Minister Avegdor Lieberman did not go to the demonstration because of his bad relations with the Yehoda and Samera council after they pressured him and other right wing ministers to resign from the government. ; Nile TV, Egypt; ANN TV, England

The Foreign Minister made these comments during an official visit to Ethiopia where he met with a number of officials including the Ethiopian Prime Minister and Foreign Minister. They discussed bi-lateral relations in addition to the issue of allowing a number of Ethiopian Jews to come to Israel so they can be reunited with their relatives. ; Al Arabiyah TV, Dubai; Al-Alam TV, Iran; During an extremely cold whether, the bulldozers of the Israeli occupation forces supported with tanks, are demolishing Palestinian homes along the borders separating between Egypt and Palatine, for the second consecutive day. There is a systematic demolishing campaign against the homes of Palestinian refugees especially in Block "O" in Rafah city where poor Palestinian refugees live. One Palestinian man said, "In this extremely cold winter, the Israeli occupation forces accompanied with ten tanks and five bulldozers, demolished fifteen homes forcing all children, women and elderly to become homeless. Only a few homes were left in this area but they are completely destroying them."; Jordan TV, Jordan
